RationalPiano.VoiceManagement
Class FadeTracking

java.lang.Object
  RationalPiano.VoiceManagement.FadeTracking

public class FadeTracking
extends java.lang.Object

Holds ADSR values and provides methods to convert a holdtime with initial velocity to current velocity.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Fabian Ehrentraud
Licence:
Licensed under the Open Software License (OSL 3.0)
Date:
2010-07-26

Constructor Detail

FadeTracking

public FadeTracking(float framerate,
                    double attack,
                    double decay,
                    double sustain,
                    double release,
                    boolean holdSustain)
Parameters:
framerate - Frame Rate of the target PApplet. Needed for scaling the attack, decay and release values which are given in seconds to frame counts.
attack - Attack time in seconds. Time the voice volume reaches the velocity after activating it.
decay - Decay time in seconds. Time the voice volume reaches the sustain level after the attack phase.
sustain - Fraction of the velocity value where a voice gets held at after attack + decay phase. 0<=sustain<=1.
release - Release Time in seconds. Time the voice volume fades to 0 after releasing it.
holdSustain - true if a voice should hold its sustain level after attack + decay phase; false = pluck mode: there is no decay phase at all, the release phase starts directly after the attack phase.
Method Detail

getCurrentVelocity

public double getCurrentVelocity(OneVoice voice)
Gets the current velocity (volume) of the given voice.

Parameters:
voice - A voice to calculate its current state for.
Returns:
The current velocity of the given voice. 0<=return<=1.

public int getAttack()
Returns:
The attack value in seconds.

public void setAttack(double attack)
Sets the attack value.

Parameters:
attack - The attack value in seconds. Must be >=0.

Returns:
The decay value in seconds.

public void setDecay(double decay)
Sets the decay value.

Parameters:
decay - The decay value in seconds. Must be >=0.

getSustain

public double getSustain()
Returns:
The sustain scale factor. Between 0 and 1.

setSustain

public void setSustain(double sustain)
Sets the sustain scale factor.

Parameters:
sustain - The sustain scale factor. Must be between 0 and 1.

getRelease

public int getRelease()
Returns:
The release value in seconds.

setRelease

public void setRelease(double release)
Sets the release value.

Parameters:
release - The release value in seconds. Must be >= 0.

setHoldSustain

public void setHoldSustain(boolean holdSustain)
Sets whether the voice should be held at the sustain value or not.

Parameters:
holdSustain - If true, a voice that is still held after the decay will stay at the initial velocity scaled by the sustain. If false, there is no decay phase and the voice will be faded out with the release time directly after the attack.

isHoldSustain

public boolean isHoldSustain()
Returns:
The boolean value wheter a voice is held at the sustain value after decay or not (release directly after attack).
